intro: Gagea scythica, commonly known as the Scythian squill, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale blue flowers. The plant produces small, rounded bulbs that are adapted for survival in rocky or dry soils. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or loamy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Gagea scythica is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
